title: Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships
dot:
digraph EngineerCodex{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];A[label="Engineer’s Codex
Publication on Real-World Software Engineering" shape=ellipse];B[label="Linus Torvalds Quote:
"Bad programmers worry about the code.
Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.""];C[label="Good Data Structures
- Easier to design and maintain
- More reliable software
- More understandable systems
- More readable code"];D[label="Design Code Around Data
- Treat data model as priority
- Avoid treating data model as an afterthought"];E[label="Actionable Tip:
Start with the Data
- Reduce code complexity
- Use stricter types on interfaces/databases"];F[label="Example:
- Restructured data eliminated problems
- 500-line function reduced to 50 lines
- Faster and easier to maintain"];G[label="Rule of Representation:
"Fold knowledge into data so program logic can be stupid and robust.""];H[label="Data is More Tractable than Code Logic
- Shift complexity from code to data"];A->B;A->C;A->D;A->E;A->F;A->G;A->H;B->C;C->D;D->E;C->F;G->H;}
